Uses of Class
org.apache.juneau.commons.collections.Lists

Packages that use Lists
Package
Description
org.apache.juneau.commons.collections
Enhanced collection utilities that extend the standard Java Collections Framework with fluent APIs, specialized collection types, and caching capabilities.
org.apache.juneau.commons.utils
Common internal utilities.
org.apache.juneau.internal
Internal Utilities

    Methods in org.apache.juneau.commons.collections that return Lists
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Lists<E>
    Lists.add(E value)
    Adds a single value to this list.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.add(E... values)
    Adds multiple values to this list.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.addAll(Collection<E> value)
    Appends the contents of the specified collection into this list.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.addAny(Object... values)
    Adds arbitrary values to this list with automatic type conversion.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.addIf(boolean flag, E value)
    Appends a value to this list of the flag is true.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.concurrent()
    When specified, build() will return a thread-safe synchronized list.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.concurrent(boolean value)
    Sets whether build() should return a thread-safe synchronized list.
    static <E> Lists<E>
    Lists.create(Class<E> elementType)
    Creates a new list builder for the specified element type.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.elementFunction(Function<Object,E> elementFunction)
    Sets the element conversion function for converting elements in addAny(Object...).
    Lists<E>
    Lists.elementType(Class<E> value)
    Specifies the element type on this list.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.filtered()
    Applies a default filter that excludes common "empty" or "unset" values from being added to the list.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.filtered(Predicate<E> filter)
    Applies a filter predicate to elements when building the list.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.sorted()
    Sorts the contents of the list.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.sorted(Comparator<E> comparator)
    Sorts the contents of the list using the specified comparator.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.sparse()
    When specified, the build() method will return null if the list is empty.
    Lists<E>
    Lists.unmodifiable()
    When specified, build() will return an unmodifiable list.
